_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:42 using v2.7
title: How has the number of nurses, midwives, and health visitors changed?
analysis_commentary:
To explore this in more detail, here we look at how the number of qualified nursing, midwifery and health visiting staff has changed.

There is annual variation in the number of nurses, midwives, and health visitors, with a trough each August followed by a rise as newly qualified staff members join the workforce. A peak in numbers is then reached in the winter, followed by a decline as staff leave the workforce. There was a decrease in the average number of staff members between 2009 and 2012, but since then the numbers have increased.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
